member.name: T:GemBox.Document.AlignmentTab
member.summary: Represents an alignment tab, also called an absolute position tab (ptab).
member.remarks: An absolute position tab is a character which is used to advance the position on the current line of text based on its and properties. The resulting end position of the tab character is not affected by the addition of any custom tab stops or changes to the value of the default tab stop.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Block
member.summary: Represents a base class for all block elements - , and .

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.BlockCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of a derived elements.

remarks.para: Although is a strongly typed collection of a derived elements, not all derived elements are supported in every .
For example, TableOfEntries.Entries supports only elements; TableCell.Blocks and HeaderFooter.Blocks support and elements; and Section.Blocks supports all derived elements.
Supported element types can be retrieved through property.
For more information, see GemBox.Document Content Model.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.CharacterFormat.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount in points by which text shall be raised or lowered for the run in relation to the default baseline of the surrounding non-positioned text. Supported only in DOCX and DOC formats.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Chart
member.summary: Represents a chart.

remarks.para: Chart is a that represents data in graphical form.
In order to create, edit, or export charts, the GemBox.Spreadsheet library needs to be loaded. Without it, charts will be preserved instead of being loaded into the .
For more information, see charts example.
is currently ignored when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats on platforms which cannot use WPF assemblies.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.ChartGrouping
member.summary: Represents the grouping of a chart series for each category in a chart.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.ChartGrouping.Standard
member.summary: Chart series are drawn on the value axis. Not applicable for ColumnChart and BarChart.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.ChartGrouping.Clustered
member.summary: Chart series are drawn next to each other along the category axis. Applicable only for ColumnChart and BarChart.

summary.para: Chart series are drawn next to each other on the value axis.
Use it to compare the contribution of each value to a total across categories.
This value is currently supported only by ColumnChart and BarChart when exporting a chart to PDF, XPS or image file formats. This value is exported as for all other chart types.
Chart series are drawn next to each other along the value axis and scaled to total 100%.
Use it to compare the percentage that each value contributes to a total across categories.
This value is currently not supported when exporting a chart to PDF, XPS or image file formats. This value is exported as for ColumnChart and BarChart and as for all other chart types.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Color
member.summary: Represents a color.

remarks.para: We deliberately didn't use Color structure from System.Drawing or any other assembly, because we wanted to expose GemBox.Document public interface through only GemBox.Document types and .NET BCL (base class library).
Because of it, GemBox.Document can be used in a various project types, like WPF, Windows Forms, ASP.NET, WCF without a need to reference System.Drawing assembly which is a Windows Forms specific.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.ComHelper.ComSetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method from your application to set GemBox.Document serial key.

remarks.para: You should call this method before using any other class from GemBox.Document assembly.
Key can only be set once (if you try another key, exception will be thrown).
The best place to call this method is from static constructor of your application's main class.
Valid serial key has multiple groups of alphanumeric characters, separated with dashes.
To use the assembly in free limited mode use FREE-LIMITED-KEY as .
For more information about GemBox.Document evaluation and licensing, see evaluation and licensing.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.ComHelper.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a document from a file with the specified path.
member.param: The path from which to load a document.
member.returns: A loaded document.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.
member.remarks:
File extension that is extracted from the is used to create the appropriate derived class instance that is then passed to the method.
Following file extensions are supported:
Microsoft Word: .docx, .docm, .dotm, .dotx
Microsoft Word 97-2003: .doc, .dot
HyperText Markup Language: .htm, .html, .mht, .mhtml
Rich Text Format: .rtf
Portable Document Format: .pdf
Plain Text: .txt
member.seealso: Open and read Word file in C# and VB.NET
Convert Word and HTML to PDF in C# and VB.NET
Convert between Word files and HTML pages in C# and VB.NET

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.ComponentInfo
member.summary: Contains static licensing methods and diagnostic information about executing GemBox.Document assembly.

member.name: E:GemBox.Document.ComponentInfo.FreeLimitReached
member.summary: Occurs in loading or saving when GemBox.Document assembly is used with FREE-LIMITED-KEY license key and free limit is reached.
member.remarks:
This event is raised when GemBox.Document assembly is used with FREE-LIMITED-KEY license key and maximum number of paragraphs per document is reached (20 paragraphs).
            
Free mode will read / write first 20 paragraphs normally and, if document has more than 20 paragraph, it will throw .
You can use this event to continue using the assembly in a trial mode for performance testing (set  to 
            ) or to stop further reading/writing (set  to 
            ).
            Trial mode will:
            
read all document content but will insert word "TRIAL" on random places in the document.
write all document content but will insert custom promotional header to all pages that come after 20th paragraph.
For more information about GemBox.Document evaluation and licensing, see evaluation and licensing.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.ContentRange
member.summary: Represents a contiguous area in a document between two s.

remarks.para: is defined by a starting and ending .

Similar to the way s are used in a document, instances are used to identify specific portions of a document. However, unlike a , a instance only exists while the programming code that defined it is running.
enables to view the document as a contiguous sequence of characters by hiding the complexity of the underlying hierarchical content model.

offers following functionalities:
Delete part of the document content with ContentRange.Delete method.
Set new content to a part of the document content with ContentRange.LoadText and ContentRange.Set methods.
Insert new content before or after a part of the document content with ContentRange.Start. (or ContentRange.Start.LoadText) and ContentRange.End. (or ContentRange.End.LoadText) methods.
Find all parts of the document content which match the specified string or specified with ContentRange.Find methods.
Export part of the document content to a textual format with ContentRange.ToString method.
is exposed on following members:

item.description: Element.Content property so that all -derived classes from GemBox.Document Content Model have it.
ElementCollection.Content property so that all collection properties from GemBox.Document Content Model have it (for example, Section.Blocks or Paragraph.Inlines).
Bookmark.GetContent(System.Boolean) method so that bookmarked content can be set, deleted, searched etc.

remarks.para: For more information, see content manipulation examples.

If current range is later expanded with additional form fields, they won't be contained in this property. To obtain latest snapshot, access content range again and use its property.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.ContentRange.SaveToClipboard(GemBox.Document.SaveOptions[])
member.summary: Saves the current to the clipboard using specified text formats.
member.param: List of type derivations mapping clipboard text formats.
member.exception: type derivation supplied inside is not supported for this operation. Use one of the supported derivations: , and

remarks.para: Applications which save data to clipboard should try to save it in all formats supporting that specific data.
Following type derivations can be used: , and . If no is specified, is saved using all supported type derivations.

member.remarks: Thread must be set to single thread apartment (STA) mode before calls to this method can be made.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.DigitalSignatureSaveOptions.Signature
member.summary: Gets or sets the signature.
member.value: The signature.

remarks.para: If value is , then digital signature won't have any visual representation.

Signature is not drawn in the same layer as the rest of the page, but in a layer above the page. If signature is contained in the document, then its position is specified through . Otherwise, if signature is not contained in the document, its position is relative to . So, if signature is not contained in the document and its layout is , then signature will have the same bottom-left position as the (they will both be in the same line). If signature is not contained in the document and its layout is , then signature will be positioned relative to regardless whether horizontal/vertical anchor is , , , or .

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.DocumentModel
member.summary: Represents a document.

remarks.para: is a central class in GemBox.Document component. It is an in-memory representation of a document file.
Document content can be retrieved through DocumentModel.Sections property. For more information, see content model.
To load / read a document from a file or a stream, use static DocumentModel.Load methods. To preserve unsupported file format features, set to . For more information, see preservation.
To save / write a document to a file or a stream use DocumentModel.Save methods. For more information, see supported file formats.

contains also following members:
DocumentModel.DefaultParagraphFormat and DocumentModel.DefaultCharacterFormat - represent formatting properties for paragraphs and text that do not have any direct, inherited or style-based formatting.
DocumentModel.Styles - a collection of all s in the document. For more information, see formattings and styles.
DocumentModel.Bookmarks - a collection of all s in the document.
DocumentModel.MailMerge - used for importing .NET objects into the document. For more information, see mail merge.
DocumentModel.DocumentProperties - a dictionaries of built-in and custom document properties.
DocumentModel.ViewOptions - defines document view and zoom when document is viewed in an application such as Microsoft Word. See view options example.
DocumentModel.WriteProtection - defines document write protection with which the document's contents can be edited but the document cannot be resaved using the same file name. See DOCX Write Protection example.

member.seealso: Open and read Word file in C# and VB.NET

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.DocumentModel.Save(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the document to a System.Web.HttpResponse or System.Web.HttpResponseBase output stream or a System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage and sets appropriate HTTP response headers (Content-Type and Content-Disposition). Use this method in ASP.NET application to send the document to a client browser. File format is resolved from extension. See remarks why parameter is of type .
member.param: System.Web.HttpResponse object that can be retrieved through the Response property of the System.Web.HttpApplication, System.Web.HttpContext, System.Web.UI.Page or System.Web.UI.UserControl classes or System.Web.HttpResponseBase object or System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage object.
File name that will be presented in client browser when downloading a file.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.

remarks.note: Supported only if updating the whole page with a postback and not if doing partial-page updates (when you use UpdatePanel controls to update selected regions of a page).
remarks.para: This method accepts rather than HttpResponse, HttpResponseBase or HttpResponseMessage because otherwise GemBox.Document assembly would have a dependency on System.Web or System.Net.Http assemblies and could not be used in applications which target Client Profile .NET Framework.
HttpResponse can be retrieved through the Response property of the HttpApplication, HttpContext, Page or UserControl classes.
For supported file extensions, see remarks for method.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.DocumentModel.CalculateListItems
member.summary: Calculates the list items contained in this document.
member.returns: A sequence of s contained in this document.

remarks.para: List (for example, ordered - with numbers, or unordered - with bullets) appearance in GemBox.Document is defined through class that is set on 's property or 's property.
is different from other formats ( and ) because it doesn't directly contain any formatting properties.
It contains a reference to a which exposes s for every list (indentation) level through its property.
s contain direct formatting properties that affect the appearance of the list. Every contains exactly 9 s, one for each possible list (indentation) level.

's list (indentation) level can be adjusted with ListFormat.ListLevelNumber property. 's list-related formatting will then be collected from the instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber. This can also be retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property.

retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property can be additionally modified to enable overriding property values of instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber on a or basis.

To create a list in a document, first instance has to be created from one of the predefined list style types specified with enumeration. After that, can be created with a specified and assigned to a 's property. For a complete example, see Lists example.
If is not referenced from anywhere in the document (from any or , then it won't be saved to a Word Document (DOCX) file, unless it is added to collection.
's list content, which prefixes paragraph content, is represented by type.
s are not permanently stored in model nor they are written to file formats which fully support , instead they are recreated each time method is called.
If document content or formatting is changed, then method should be called again to retrieve the latest list items.
For convenience, after calling method, can also be retrieved from property.

After calling on instance retrieved by calling on instance returned from method, paragraph's property will be even if paragraph's is . This enables easy iteration over s returned from method by using foreach statement and removing all references to s after the iteration is finished.

member.summary: Represents a set of document protection restrictions which have been applied to the contents of a document.
member.remarks: Document protection is a set of restrictions used to prevent unintentional changes to all or part of a document - since this protection does not encrypt the document, malicious applications may circumvent its use. This protection is not intended as a security feature and may be ignored.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.DocumentSettings.Footnote
member.summary: Gets the footnote settings.
member.value: The footnote settings.
member.remarks:
can be configured using on a document level ( and ) or on a section level ( and . Document level settings are cloned when new is added to the . is currently supported in DOCX and PDF formats. While DOCX format is fully supported, PDF format has the following limitations:
Footnotes are always rendered on the same page as their references.
Footnotes that don't fit on a single page are clipped.
Note numbering setting is not supported.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.DocxSaveOptions.ImageDpi
member.summary: Gets or sets the saved images DPI.
member.value: The saved images DPI.
member.remarks:
This property controls the image quality for all images in the file. Larger value results in better-quality images but increases the file size. Setting this property to 0 will disable image optimization. Standard DPI values are:
330 - Good quality for HD displays
220 - Good quality for most printers and displays
150 - Good quality for web pages and projectors
96 - Good quality for smaller file sizes

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Drawing.DrawingElement
member.summary: Represents a base class for all drawings (shapes, text-boxes, pictures, etc.).

remarks.para: can contain metadata (non-visual properties) which is available through DrawingElement.Metadata property.
can be positioned in-line with the rest of the document content or floating within document content. For more information, see remarks for DrawingElement.Layout property.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.Drawing.DrawingElement.Layout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout (position and size).
member.value: The layout (position and size).

remarks.para: Drawing elements (, or ) can be embedded / positioned (by using DrawingElement.Layout property):

item.description: In line with the text ( type) - affects the line height and layout of its line (like a character glyph of similar size).
Floating within the text relative to the page ( type) - affects the layout of its surrounding content which is either wrapped around or in-front / behind the floating element.

remarks.para: Besides position, embeddable element must also have size specified. Drawing element's position and size are contained in DrawingElement.Layout property.
Embedded element's layout can be specified by either instantiating appropriate derived type, such as or , or by using factory methods Layout.Inline() or Layout.Floating().
For more information, see Shapes and Layout article.

member.value: The metadata (non-visual properties) of this instance.

member.summary: Clones this instance.
member.param: If set to clone all descendants recursively; otherwise clone only current .
member.returns: Cloned .

remarks.para: Document content element instance can exist only in a one place in the document.
If you want to insert document content element into some other part of the same document, then clone the element and insert its clone.
If you want to insert document content element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with method and then insert the imported element.
For more information, see cloning example.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.Drawing.FormattedDrawingElement.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the drawing to a file with the specified path. Path must include file extension.
member.param: The path to which to save the drawing.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.
member.remarks:
File extension that is extracted from the is used to create the appropriate derived class instance that is then passed to the method.
Following file extensions are supported:
Portable Document Format: .pdf
XML Paper Specification: .xps
Portable Network Graphics: .png
Joint Photographic Experts Group: .jpeg, .jpg
Bitmap: .bmp
Tagged Image File Format: .tiff, .tif
Windows Media Photo: .wdp

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.Drawing.FormattedDrawingElement.Save(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the drawing to a System.Web.HttpResponse or System.Web.HttpResponseBase output stream or a System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage and sets appropriate HTTP response headers (Content-Type and Content-Disposition). Use this method in ASP.NET application to send the drawing to a client browser. File format is resolved from extension. See remarks why parameter is of type .
member.param: System.Web.HttpResponse object that can be retrieved through the Response property of the System.Web.HttpApplication, System.Web.HttpContext, System.Web.UI.Page or System.Web.UI.UserControl classes or System.Web.HttpResponseBase object or System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage object.
File name that will be presented in client browser when downloading a file.
member.exception: If file extension is not specified or not supported. If file extension is not recognized, use method overload instead.

remarks.note: Supported only if updating the whole page with a postback and not if doing partial-page updates (when you use UpdatePanel controls to update selected regions of a page).
remarks.para: This method accepts rather than HttpResponse, HttpResponseBase or HttpResponseMessage because otherwise GemBox.Document assembly would have a dependency on System.Web or System.Net.Http assemblies and could not be used in applications which target Client Profile .NET Framework.
HttpResponse can be retrieved through the Response property of the HttpApplication, HttpContext, Page or UserControl classes.
For supported file extensions, see remarks for method.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.Drawing.ShapeType.Oval
member.summary: The oval (ellipse).

summary.para: The rectangle with rounded corners.

Use adjust value 'adj' to specify the amount of roundness for a rounded rectangle as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields square corners (like ) and value of 50000 forms circular corners (a square with adjust value of 50000 is a circle). Default value is 16667, which means that rounded corner radius will be 16.667% of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle.
The rectangle with rounded diagonal corners.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the amount of roundness for a top left and bottom right corner as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields square corners (like ) and value of 50000 forms circular corners (a square with adjust value of 50000 is a circle). Default value is 16667, which means that rounded corner radius will be 16.667% of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle.

Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the amount of roundness for a top right and bottom left corner as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields square corners (like ) and value of 50000 forms circular corners (a square with adjust value of 50000 is a circle). Default value is 16667, which means that rounded corner radius will be 16.667% of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle.
The rectangle with single rounded corner.

Use adjust value 'adj' to specify the amount of roundness for a rounded rectangle corner as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields square corner (like ) and value of 50000 forms circular corner (a square with adjust value of 50000 is a circle). Default value is 16667, which means that rounded corner radius will be 16.667% of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle.
The rectangle with rounded corners of the same side.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the amount of roundness for a top left and top right corner as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields square corners (like ) and value of 50000 forms circular corners (a square with adjust value of 50000 is a circle). Default value is 16667, which means that rounded corner radius will be 16.667% of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle.

Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the amount of roundness for a bottom left and bottom right corner as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields square corners (like ) and value of 50000 forms circular corners (a square with adjust value of 50000 is a circle). Default value is 16667, which means that rounded corner radius will be 16.667% of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle.
The block arrow pointing to the right.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the thickness of the arrow shaft as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000. Value of 0 yields very thin shaft (almost invisible) and value of 100000 forms the shaft of the same thickness as the height of the whole shape (like ). Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow shaft thickness will be half of the shape height.

Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the length of the arrow tip as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000 * Math.Max(width / height, 1). Value of 0 yields very small tip (almost invisible) and value of 100000 * Math.Max(width / height, 1) forms the tip of the same length as the width of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow tip length will be half of the shape height.
The block arrow pointing down.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the thickness of the arrow shaft as a percentage of the width of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000. Value of 0 yields very thin shaft (almost invisible) and value of 100000 forms the shaft of the same thickness as the width of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow shaft thickness will be half of the shape width.

Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the length of the arrow tip as a percentage of the width of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1). Value of 0 yields very small tip (almost invisible) and value of 100000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1) forms the tip of the same length as the height of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow tip length will be half of the shape width.
The block arrow pointing to the left.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the thickness of the arrow shaft as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000. Value of 0 yields very thin shaft (almost invisible) and value of 100000 forms the shaft of the same thickness as the height of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow shaft thickness will be half of the shape height.

Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the length of the arrow tip as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000 * Math.Max(width / height, 1). Value of 0 yields very small tip (almost invisible) and value of 100000 * Math.Max(width / height, 1) forms the tip of the same length as the width of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow tip length will be half of the shape height.
The block arrow pointing up.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the thickness of the arrow shaft as a percentage of the width of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000. Value of 0 yields very thin shaft (almost invisible) and value of 100000 forms the shaft of the same thickness as the width of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow shaft thickness will be half of the shape width.

Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the length of the arrow tip as a percentage of the width of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1). Value of 0 yields very small tip (almost invisible) and value of 100000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1) forms the tip of the same length as the height of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow tip length will be half of the shape width.
The double-sided block arrow pointing to the left and right.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the thickness of the arrow shaft as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000. Value of 0 yields very thin shaft (almost invisible) and value of 100000 forms the shaft of the same thickness as the height of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow shaft thickness will be half of the shape height.

Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the length of the arrow tips as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000 * Math.Max(width / height, 1). Value of 0 yields very small tips (almost invisible) and value of 50000 * Math.Max(width / height, 1) forms the tips of the same length as the half of the width of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow tip length will be half of the shape height.
The double-side block arrow pointing up and down.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the thickness of the arrow shaft as a percentage of the width of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000. Value of 0 yields very thin shaft (almost invisible) and value of 100000 forms the shaft of the same thickness as the width of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow shaft thickness will be half of the shape width.

Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the length of the arrow tip as a percentage of the width of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1). Value of 0 yields very small tips (almost invisible) and value of 100000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1) forms the tips of the same length as the height of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow tip length will be half of the shape width.
The rectangular callout (speech bubble).
Use adjust values 'adj1' and 'adj2' to specify the position of the tip of the callout wedge.

'adj1' specifies the horizontal position relatively to the center of the shape as the percentage of the shape width. Value of -50000 places the tip horizontally on the level of the left edge of the shape. Value of 50000 places it on the level of the right edge. Default value is -20000.

'adj2' specifies the vertical position relatively to the center of the shape as the percentage of the shape height. Value of -50000 places the tip vertically on the level of the top edge of the shape. Value of 50000 places it on the level of the bottom edge. Default value is 60000.
The rectangular callout (speech bubble) with rounded corners.
Use adjust values 'adj1' and 'adj2' to specify the position of the tip of the callout wedge.

'adj1' specifies the horizontal position relatively to the center of the shape as the percentage of the shape width. Value of -50000 places the tip horizontally on the level of the left edge of the shape. Value of 50000 places it on the level of the right edge. Default value is -20000.

'adj2' specifies the vertical position relatively to the center of the shape as the percentage of the shape height. Value of -50000 places the tip vertically on the level of the top edge of the shape. Value of 50000 places it on the level of the bottom edge. Default value is 60000.
The oval callout (speech bubble).
Use adjust values 'adj1' and 'adj2' to specify the position of the tip of the callout wedge.

'adj1' specifies the horizontal position relatively to the center of the shape as the percentage of the shape width. Value of -50000 places the tip horizontally on the level of the left edge of the shape. Value of 50000 places it on the level of the right edge. Default value is -20000.

'adj2' specifies the vertical position relatively to the center of the shape as the percentage of the shape height. Value of -50000 places the tip vertically on the level of the top edge of the shape. Value of 50000 places it on the level of the bottom edge. Default value is 60000.
The block arrow in the shape of a pentagon pointing to the right.

Use adjust value 'adj' to specify the length of the arrow tip as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000 * Math.Max(width / height, 1). Value of 0 yields very small tip (almost invisible) and value of 100000 * Math.Max(width / height, 1) forms the tip of the same length as the width of the whole shape. Default value is 50000, which means that the arrow tip length will be half of the shape height.
The Trapezoid.

Use adjust value 'adj' to specify the distance of the top side from the left (and right) side of the shape as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1). Value of 0 yields trapezoid with top side adjacent to the left and right side (like ) and value of 100000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1) forms a trapezoid with top side of zero length (so basically a triangle). Default value is 50000.
The Parallelogram.

Use adjust value 'adj' to specify the distance of the top side from the left side and bottom side from the right side of the shape as a percentage of the height of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1). Value of 0 yields trapezoid with top side adjacent to the left and right side (like ) and value of 100000 * Math.Max(height / width, 1) forms a trapezoid with top side of zero length (so basically a triangle). Default value is 50000.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.Drawing.ShapeType.Diamond
member.summary: The Diamond.

summary.para: The Triangle with the right angle in the bottom left corner.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.Drawing.ShapeType.IsoscelesTriangle
member.summary:
The triangle.
Use adjust value 'adj' to specify the distance of the top point from the left edge of the shape as a percentage of the width of the whole shape. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 100000. Value of 0 yields a triangle with the right angle in the bottom left corner. (like ) and value of 100000 forms a triangle with the right angle in the bottom tight corner. Default value is 50000, which form isosceles triangle.

summary.para: The rectangle with top right corner snipped.

Use adjust value 'adj' to specify the distance of the snip from the top right corner of the shape as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields a rectangle with no snip (like ) and value of 50000 creates a snip with distance of half of the length of width or height depending which one is smaller. Default value is 16667.
The rectangle with top and bottom corners snipped in the same way.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the distance of the top snip from the corner of the shape as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields a rectangle with no top snip and value of 50000 creates a snip with distance of half of the length of width or height depending which one is smaller. Default value is 16667. Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the distance of the bottom snip from the corner of the shape as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields a rectangle with no top snip and value of 50000 creates a snip with distance of half of the length of width or height depending which one is smaller. Default value is 16667.
The rectangle with corners on the same diagonal snipped in the same way.

Use adjust value 'adj1' to specify the distance of the top left and bottom right snip from the corner of the shape as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields a rectangle with no top snip and value of 50000 creates a snip with distance of half of the length of width or height depending which one is smaller. Default value is 16667. Use adjust value 'adj2' to specify the distance of the top right and bottom left snip from the corner of the shape as a percentage of the smaller dimension of the width and height of the rectangle. Adjust value should be in range from 0 to 50000. Value of 0 yields a rectangle with no top snip and value of 50000 creates a snip with distance of half of the length of width or height depending which one is smaller. Default value is 16667.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Field
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for placeholders, such as page reference numbers, which can be added to a document such that those placeholders are replaced by their corresponding values when the document is rendered for display or print.

remarks.para: Fields are used in a mail merge and, usually, in scenarios where document information can be resolved only when document is rendered (for example, page numbers).
GemBox.Document supports nested fields - another field can be contained in an or a properties of a field.

Fields are defined by the Field.FieldType and, optionally, Field.InstructionInlines that usually contains field arguments and switches, but can also contain other fields, and Field.ResultInlines that contains the latest field's value.
For a field creation example, see fields example.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.Field.IsDirty
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the result of this field is invalid and, because of that, it should be updated.
member.remarks: The property value of true specifies that the result of this field is no longer based on the contents of the document, and should be recalculated whenever an application with this functionality reads the document (for example MS Word).
member.value: if result of this field is invalid and, because of that, it should be updated; otherwise, .

member.summary: Gets the field instruction s.

member.remarks:
This collection is not considered to be a part of document content because field's instructions are a part of field's definition. Its type, , was used as a convenience so we can support both instruction text and nested fields. Because of it, on a will not return in a property.
All derived elements are supported in this collection.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.Field.Update
member.summary: Updates the of the current .

remarks.para: To update page related fields (, , , and ) and field create an instance of , set its to and call the method with that instance.
To update mail merge related fields (, , , etc.) call the method and provide it the data source object.
This method currently supports updating following field types:
More field types can be expected to be supported in a future versions of GemBox.Document.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.Field.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones this instance, and optionally clones it's result.
member.returns: Cloned .

remarks.para: Document content element instance can exist only in a one place in the document.
If you want to insert document content element into some other part of the same document, then clone the element and insert its clone.
If you want to insert document content element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with method and then insert the imported element.
For more information, see cloning example.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.FieldType
member.summary: Represents a field type that is used in defining s.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Unknown
member.summary: Field type cannot be resolved because does not start with s that specify valid field code.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.CreateDate
member.summary: Retrieves the date and time at which the document was created.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Date
member.summary: Retrieves the current date and time.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.EditTime
member.summary: Retrieves the total editing time, in minutes, since the document was created.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.PrintDate
member.summary: Retrieves the date and time on which the document was last printed.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.SaveDate
member.summary: Retrieves the date and time on which the document was last saved.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Time
member.summary: Retrieves the current date and time.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Compare
member.summary: Compares the values designated by two expressions using the designated operator. Field value is 1 if the comparison is true, or 0 if the comparison is false.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.DocVariable
member.summary: Inserts the string assigned to the document variable designated by field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.GoToButton
member.summary: Inserts a jump command, such that when it is activated, the insertion point of the document is moved to the location specified by field argument. First field argument can be a bookmark, a page number, or some other item. Second field argument is the text or graphic "button" that appears in the document, such that it can be selected to activate the jump.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.If
member.summary: Compares the values designated by two expressions using the designated operator. Field value is first field argument if the comparison is true; otherwise, second field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.MacroButton
member.summary: Allows the macro or command designated by first field argument to be run. Second field argument designates the text or graphic to appear as the "button" that is selected to run the macro or command.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Print
member.summary: Sends the printer-specific control code characters specified by field argument to the selected printer.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Author
member.summary: Retrieves, and optionally sets, the document author's name.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Comments
member.summary: Retrieves, and optionally sets, the comments relating to the current document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.DocProperty
member.summary: Retrieves the document information indicated by document property category field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.FileName
member.summary: Retrieves the name of the current document as stored on disk.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.FileSize
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the current document in bytes.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Info
member.summary: A field of this kind is treated as if INFO was omitted and info category field argument was a field-type name.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Keywords
member.summary: Retrieves, and optionally sets, the document's keywords.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.LastSavedBy
member.summary: Retrieves the name of the user who last modified and saved the current document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.NumChars
member.summary: Retrieves the number of characters in the current document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.NumPages
member.summary: Retrieves the number of pages in the current document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.NumWords
member.summary: Retrieves the number of words in the current document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Subject
member.summary: Retrieves, and optionally sets, the document's subject.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Template
member.summary: Retrieves the disk file name of the template used by the current document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Title
member.summary: Retrieves, and optionally sets, the document's title.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Formula
member.summary: Represents an arbitrary complex arithmetic expression involving constants, bookmarks that refer to expressions, arithmetic and logical operators, functions, values of cells in a table, and fields that result in a single value. Expression can contain grouping parentheses to document the default precedence or to override it.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Advance
member.summary: Moves the starting point of text that follows the field to the right or left, up or down, or to a specific horizontal or vertical position.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Eq
member.summary: Computes the specified mathematical equation.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Symbol
member.summary: Retrieves the character whose code point value is specified in decimal or hexadecimal (by using a leading 0x or 0X) in field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Index
member.summary: Builds an index using the index entries specified by XE fields, and inserts that index at this place in the document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.RD
member.summary: Field argument identifies a file to include when creating a table of contents, a table of authorities, or an index using a TOC, TOA, or INDEX field.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.TA
member.summary: Defines the text and page number for a table of authorities entry, which is used by a TOA field.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.TC
member.summary: Defines the text and page number for a table of contents (including a table of figures) entry, which is used by a TOC field. The text of the entry is field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.TOA
member.summary: Builds a table of authorities (that is, a list of the references in a legal document, such as references to cases, statutes, and rules, along with the numbers of the pages on which the references appear) using the entries specified by TA fields.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.TOC
member.summary: Builds a table of contents (which can also be a table of figures) using the entries specified by TC fields, their heading levels, and specified styles, and inserts that table at this place in the document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.XE
member.summary: Defines the text and page number for an index entry, which is used by an INDEX field. The text of the entry is field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.AutoText
member.summary: Inserts the AutoText entry whose name is specified by field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.AutoTextList
member.summary: Creates a shortcut menu based on AutoText entries in the active template. The list can vary based on the styles applied to the AutoText entries. Field argument is inserted into the document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Bibliography
member.summary: Retrieves and displays the formatted bibliographic data for all sources in the current document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Citation
member.summary: Displays the formatted contents of the bibliography entry for a source or reference work with a tag name of a source matching field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Hyperlink
member.summary: When selected, causes control to jump to the location specified by field argument. That location can be a bookmark or a URL.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.IncludePicture
member.summary: Retrieves the picture contained in the document named by field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.IncludeText
member.summary: Inserts all or part of the text and graphics contained in the document named by first field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Link
member.summary: For information copied from another application, this field links that information to its original source file using OLE.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.NoteRef
member.summary: Inserts the mark of the footnote or endnote that is marked by the bookmark specified by field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.PageRef
member.summary: Inserts the number of the page containing the bookmark specified by field argument for a cross-reference.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Quote
member.summary: Retrieves the text specified by field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Ref
member.summary: Inserts the text or graphics represented by the bookmark specified by field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.StyleRef
member.summary: Inserts the nearest piece of text prior to this field that is formatted by the style whose name is specified by field argument. The style can be a paragraph style or a character style.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.AddressBlock
member.summary: Inserts a mail merge address block.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Ask
member.summary: Prompts the user to enter information and assigns the bookmark designated by first field argument to represent the user's response. Second field argument specifies the prompt text, which is displayed in a dialog box.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Database
member.summary: Inserts the results of a database query into a .

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.FillIn
member.summary: Prompts the user to enter text. Field argument contains the prompt.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.GreetingLine
member.summary: Inserts a mail merge greeting line.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.MergeField
member.summary: Retrieves the name of a data field designated by field argument within the merge characters in a mail merge main document. When the main document is merged with the selected data source, information from the specified data field is inserted in place of the merge field.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.MergeRec
member.summary: Use this in a mail merge to print the number of the corresponding merged data record in each resulting merged document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.MergeSeq
member.summary: The number of data records that were successfully merged with the main document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Next
member.summary: Merges the next data record into the current resulting merged document, rather than starting a new merged document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.NextIf
member.summary: Compares the values designated by two expressions using the designated operator. If the comparison is true, the next data record is merged into the current merge document. Merge fields that follow the NEXTIF in the main document are replaced by values from the next data record rather than the current data record. If the comparison is false, the next data record is merged into a new merge document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Set
member.summary: Defines the bookmark name specified by first field argument to represent the information specified by second field argument.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.SkipIf
member.summary: Compares the values designated by two expressions using the designated operator. If the comparison is true, SKIPIF cancels the current merge document, moves to the next in the data source, and starts a new merge document. If the comparison is false, the current merge document is continued.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.AutoNum
member.summary: In paragraphs formatted with one of the nine built-in heading styles, paragraph numbering restarts at 1 in each successive heading level. If headings that contain AUTONUM fields are followed by body text paragraphs that also contain AUTONUM fields, the paragraph numbering of the body text is restarted at 1 after each heading. If the headings don't contain AUTONUM fields, body text paragraphs that contain AUTONUM fields are numbered in a continuous, sequential series throughout the document. This field is supported for legacy reasons, it is recommended that LISTNUM be used instead.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.AutoNumLgl
member.summary: For legal and technical publications, use the nine built-in heading styles to format headings in the document, and then insert an AUTONUMLGL field at the beginning of each heading paragraph. This field is supported for legacy reasons, it is recommended that LISTNUM be used instead.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.AutoNumOut
member.summary: Use the nine built-in heading styles to format headings in the document, and then insert an AUTONUMOUT field at the beginning of each heading paragraph. This field is supported for legacy reasons, it is recommended that LISTNUM be used instead.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.BarCode
member.summary: Produces a postal bar code that is a machine-readable form of address used by the U.S. Postal Service.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.ListNum
member.summary: Computes the next integral number from the current or a specific series, or a specific number from the next or specific series.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Page
member.summary: Retrieves the number of the current page.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.RevNum
member.summary: Retrieves the document's revision number (which indicates the number of times the document has been saved).

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Section
member.summary: Retrieves the number of the current section.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.SectionPages
member.summary: Retrieves the number of the current page within the current section.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.Seq
member.summary: Sequentially numbers chapters, tables, figures, and other user-defined lists of items in a document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.UserAddress
member.summary: Retrieves the current user's postal address or, if field argument is present, the address specified by field argument. Specifying a field argument shall not change the address of the current user.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.UserInitials
member.summary: Retrieves the current user's initials or, if field argument is present, the initials specified by field argument. Specifying a field argument shall not change the initials of the current user.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.UserName
member.summary: Retrieves the current user's name or, if field argument is present, the name specified by field argument. Specifying a field argument shall not change the name of the current user.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.FormCheckBox
member.summary: Inserts a check box style form field which, when the editing of form fields is enabled, can be checked and unchecked.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.FormDropDown
member.summary: Inserts a drop-down list style form field which, when the editing of form fields is enabled, can be used to select an entry in the list.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.FormText
member.summary: Inserts a text box style form field which, when the editing of form fields is enabled, can be typed into.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.DisplayBarcode
member.summary: Renders a generated barcode symbol using the data in this display field.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.FieldType.MergeBarcode
member.summary: This field is analogous to the field code, . The main difference is that generates a field based on the merge result instead of showing it directly. The syntax of field instruction and supported switches is also different.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.FloatingLayout
member.summary: Represents a floating which is used to embed document element in a page outside of the main content flow. Main content flow is usually wrapped around embedded element.

remarks.para: Drawing elements (, or ) can be embedded / positioned (by using DrawingElement.Layout property):

item.description: In line with the text ( type) - affects the line height and layout of its line (like a character glyph of similar size).
Floating within the text relative to the page ( type) - affects the layout of its surrounding content which is either wrapped around or in-front / behind the floating element.

remarks.para: Besides position, embeddable element must also have size specified. Drawing element's position and size are contained in DrawingElement.Layout property.
Embedded element's layout can be specified by either instantiating appropriate derived type, such as or , or by using factory methods Layout.Inline() or Layout.Floating().
For more information, see Shapes and Layout article.

member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical position.
member.value: The vertical position.

member.summary: Gets or sets the setting for how text is wrapped around the floating element.
member.value: The setting for how text is wrapped around the floating element.
member.remarks: Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.FloatingLayout.WrapText
member.summary: Gets or sets the setting for how text can wrap around the floating element's left and right sides.
member.value: The setting for how text can wrap around the floating element's left and right sides.
member.remarks: Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.FloatingLayout.DistanceFromText
member.summary: Gets or sets the distances between the edges of a floating element and any subsequent text within the document.
member.value: The distances between the edges of a floating element and any subsequent text within the document.
member.remarks: Default value is: Top: 0 cm, Bottom: 0 cm, Left: 0.32 cm, Right: 0.32 cm.

item.description: In line with the text ( type) - affects the line height and layout of its line (like a character glyph of similar size).
Floating within the text relative to the page ( type) - affects the layout of its surrounding content which is either wrapped around or in-front / behind the floating element.

remarks.para: Besides position, embeddable element must also have size specified. Drawing element's position and size are contained in DrawingElement.Layout property.
Embedded element's layout can be specified by either instantiating appropriate derived type, such as or , or by using factory methods Layout.Inline() or Layout.Floating().
For more information, see Shapes and Layout article.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.FontSettings.FontsBaseResourceLocation

summary.para: Gets or sets the base resource location where component looks for fonts specified as resources inside the local or referenced assembly.
Read Remarks for details about the format of the for desktop and web applications.

member.value: The base resource location where component looks for fonts specified as resources inside the local or referenced assembly.

note.para: When you add fonts as resources to your application, make sure you are setting the <Resource> element when targeting .NET Framework or when targeting .NET Core with enabled WPF.
Otherwise, use <EmbeddedResource> element for the build action.

remarks.para: Following image shows an example of a Windows Console project structure with font files added as resources.
Following table illustrates the various base resource locations that you can specify to use fonts from the above Windows Console project structure.
Resource locations consist of required and adjustable parts.

tr.td: Font resource files are in the root of local assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of local assembly.
Font resource files are in the root of referenced assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of referenced assembly.

remarks.para: Following image shows an example of a Web ASP.NET project structure with font files added as resources.
Following table illustrates the various base resource locations that you can specify to use fonts from the above Web ASP.NET project structure.
Since ASP.NET assembly is actually a class library referenced from ASP.NET web server, resource location must always include ;component part.

tr.td: Font resource files are in the root of local assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of local assembly.
Font resource files are in the root of referenced assembly.
Font resource files are in the subfolder of referenced assembly.

member.summary: Represents a collection of elements.

remarks.para: cannot contain multiple elements with equal HeaderFooter.HeaderFooterType.
Following rules apply for headers / footers contained in a collection:

item.description: / - header / footer will be applied to every page in a section.
/ - header / footer will be applied to only even pages in a section. Overrides / on even pages, if also contained in a collection.
/ - header / footer will be applied to only first page in a section. Overrides both / and / on first page, if also contained in a collection.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use semantic elements when generating a HTML.
To maintain backward compatibility, default value is .

The type of the semantic element that will be used is inferred either from a document element type, some of its properties or its style. For example, <h1> to <h6> HTML elements will be used for paragraphs with 'Heading 1' to 'Heading 6' styles. This feature is currently not fully implemented. Support for various HTML semantic elements (especially those defined in HTML5) will be added gradually.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ImageSaveOptions.MetafileScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images. Greater scaling factor improves quality but also increases file size. Default value is 1.
member.value: The metafile scale factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images.

remarks.para: Windows Metafile Format (WMF) and Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) are vector image formats which contain a series of graphics drawing commands usually executed in Windows GDI layer.
Metafile drawing commands could also be executed in PDF (or XPS) file which is also vector format, but for that Metafile drawing commands would have to be converted to PDF drawing commands.

GemBox.Document currently doesn't perform this conversion of drawing commands, instead it uses Windows GDI to execute Metafile drawing commands into bitmap which is then encoded to PNG format and embedded into PDF file.
specifies the size of the bitmap surface, based from the original Metafile surface size, into which Metafile should be drawn / rasterized.

PDF viewer will still scale the bitmap to the original Metafile size, but if the page is zoomed or viewed on a larger surface, quality of the image will be better since it contains more pixels / dots which will become visible while PDF viewer scales down the image.

increases the quality of the Metafile image in PDF file, but it also increases the size of the PDF file because greater means greater bitmap surface and more space to store bitmap pixel / color data. PNG encoding / compression helps in reducing the space requirement and for complex Metafiles (with a lot of drawing instructions), of 5 or even greater, might not incur any space overhead relative to the original (complex) Metafile.
Default value for is 1.

image/png if is ,

image/bmp if is ,
image/tiff if is ,
image/vnd.ms-photo if is .
member.value: The content-type for image file format.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.ImportMapping
member.summary: Represents a mapping of styles (and other referenced objects) from source document to destination document when importing elements between two different instances.
member.remarks: Same instance can be used for multiple imports. This improves performances because matching styles (mapping from source document style to destination document style) do not have to be identified in subsequent imports if they where matched in previous imports. It also reduces memory usage and provides more consistent behavior in some particular scenarios which involve importing list paragraphs, list styles and paragraph styles which contain list formatting.

member.value: The source document.

member.value: The destination document.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ImportMapping.UseDestinationStyles
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to use destination document styles if they have the same name as source document styles, even though they do not have the same formatting.
member.value: to use destination document styles; otherwise, .
member.remarks: Destination document and with . equal to are never used, because that would continue numbering of imported paragraphs in destination document and thus imported paragraphs would influence on the numbering of the rest of the paragraphs in destination document. If imported paragraphs with specific should continue numbering in destination document, then set explicit mapping from source (of these imported paragraphs) to destination onto which numbering should continue.

remarks.para: Document content element instance can exist only in a one place in the document.
If you want to insert document content element into some other part of the same document, then clone the element and insert its clone.
If you want to insert document content element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with method and then insert the imported element.
For more information, see cloning example.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.InlineCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of derived elements.

remarks.para: Although is a strongly typed collection of a derived elements, not all derived elements are supported in every .
For example, Paragraph.Inlines and Field.ResultInlines support all derived elements, and Hyperlink.DisplayInlines doesn't support element.
Supported element types can be retrieved through property.
For more information, see GemBox.Document Content Model.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.InlineLayout
member.summary: Represents an in-line which is used to embed document element in the current line of the main content flow.

remarks.para: Drawing elements (, or ) can be embedded / positioned (by using DrawingElement.Layout property):

item.description: In line with the text ( type) - affects the line height and layout of its line (like a character glyph of similar size).
Floating within the text relative to the page ( type) - affects the layout of its surrounding content which is either wrapped around or in-front / behind the floating element.

remarks.para: Besides position, embeddable element must also have size specified. Drawing element's position and size are contained in DrawingElement.Layout property.
Embedded element's layout can be specified by either instantiating appropriate derived type, such as or , or by using factory methods Layout.Inline() or Layout.Floating().
For more information, see Shapes and Layout article.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.ListFormat
member.summary: Represents list format which shall be applied to the contents of the parent paragraph.

remarks.para: List (for example, ordered - with numbers, or unordered - with bullets) appearance in GemBox.Document is defined through class that is set on 's property or 's property.
is different from other formats ( and ) because it doesn't directly contain any formatting properties.
It contains a reference to a which exposes s for every list (indentation) level through its property.
s contain direct formatting properties that affect the appearance of the list. Every contains exactly 9 s, one for each possible list (indentation) level.

's list (indentation) level can be adjusted with ListFormat.ListLevelNumber property. 's list-related formatting will then be collected from the instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber. This can also be retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property.

retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property can be additionally modified to enable overriding property values of instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber on a or basis.

To create a list in a document, first instance has to be created from one of the predefined list style types specified with enumeration. After that, can be created with a specified and assigned to a 's property. For a complete example, see Lists example.
If is not referenced from anywhere in the document (from any or , then it won't be saved to a Word Document (DOCX) file, unless it is added to collection.
's list content, which prefixes paragraph content, is represented by type.
s are not permanently stored in model nor they are written to file formats which fully support , instead they are recreated each time method is called.
If document content or formatting is changed, then method should be called again to retrieve the latest list items.
For convenience, after calling method, can also be retrieved from property.

After calling on instance retrieved by calling on instance returned from method, paragraph's property will be even if paragraph's is . This enables easy iteration over s returned from method by using foreach statement and removing all references to s after the iteration is finished.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.Level
member.summary: Gets the level of this .
member.value: The level of this .
member.remarks: This value is a zero-based index of the number of list levels in the document. For example, a value of 2 is the 3rd list level in the document.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.StartAt
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting number for this list level.
member.value: The starting number for this list level.

remarks.para: This value is used when this level initially starts in a document, as well as whenever it is restarted via the property.
Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.NumberStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the number style.
member.value: The number style.

remarks.para: This property specifies the number style which shall be used to display all numbering at this level. This information is used to replace the level text string %x in property, where x is a particular one based level index, with the appropriate value. This value shall be calculated by counting the number of paragraphs at this level since the last restart using the numbering system defined in this property.
Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.RestartAfterLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the list level that must appear before the specified list level restarts numbering.
member.value: The list level that must appear before the specified list level restarts numbering.

remarks.para: This property specifies a one-based index which determines when a list level should restart to its value. A list level restarts when an instance of the specified list level, which shall be higher (earlier than the this level) is used in the given document's contents.

Default value is zero-based level of this which means that list level shall restart each time the previous list level is used. If the specified level is higher than the current level, then this element shall be ignored. As well, a value of 0 shall specify that this level shall never restart.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.AssociatedParagraphStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the which shall use this list level when applied to the contents of the document.
member.value: The which shall use this list level when applied to the contents of the document.

remarks.para: When a is defined to include a , any list level defined by shall be ignored, and instead this property shall specify the list level associated with that .
Default value is which means that no is associated with this list level.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.IsLegal
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which specifies whether or not all previous levels displayed for a given list level's text specified in the property shall be displayed using the (Arabic numerals), regardless of the actual of that level in the list.
member.value: The value which specifies whether or not all previous levels displayed for a given list level's text specified in the property shall be displayed using the (Arabic numerals), regardless of the actual of that level in the list.

remarks.para: If this property is , then all list levels present in the property shall be converted to their decimal equivalents when they are displayed in this level. If this property is , then each level is displayed using the of that level.
Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.TrailingCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which specifies the content which shall be added between a given list level's text specified in the property and the text of every numbered paragraph which references that list level.
member.value: The value which specifies the content which shall be added between a given list level's text specified in the property and the text of every numbered paragraph which references that list level.
member.remarks: Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.NumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which specifies the textual content which shall be displayed when displaying a paragraph with the given list level.
member.value: A value which specifies the textual content which shall be displayed when displaying a paragraph with the given list level.

remarks.para: All text in this property's value shall be taken as literal text to be repeated in each instance of this list level, except for any use of the percent symbol (%) followed by a number, which shall be used to indicate the one-based index of the number to be used at this level. Any number of a level higher than this level shall be ignored.

When the % syntax is used, the number shall be incremented for each subsequent paragraph of that level (sequential or not), until the restart level is seen between two subsequent paragraphs of this level.
Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.BulletPicture
member.summary: Gets or sets a picture which shall be used as a list symbol for a given list level.
member.value: A picture which shall be used as a list symbol for a given list level.

remarks.para: The picture shall be added to the list level by replacing each character in the with one instance of this image.
Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment used on a list level's text specified in the property within a given list level.
member.value: The horizontal alignment used on a list level's text specified in the property within a given list level.

remarks.para: This alignment is applied relative to the text margin of the parent numbered paragraph in the document.
Default value is .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: Gets the paragraph format which shall be applied as part of a given list level. This paragraph format is applied to any numbered paragraph that uses this list level.
member.value: The paragraph format which shall be applied as part of a given list level.
member.remarks: Paragraph format properties specified on the numbered paragraph itself override the paragraph format properties specified on a list level used by that paragraph.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormat.CharacterFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the character format which shall be applied to the list level's text specified in the property when it is applied to paragraphs in this document.
member.value: The character format which shall be applied to the list level's text specified in the property when it is applied to paragraphs in this document.
member.remarks: This character format is applied to all numbering level text used by a list level. It should be noted that character format specified on a numbered paragraph itself, or on text runs within a numbered paragraph, are separate from the character format specified within a list level, as the latter affects only the numbering text itself, not the remainder of runs in the numbered paragraph.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.ListLevelFormatCollection
member.summary: Represents a read-only collection of list level formatting.

remarks.para: List (for example, ordered - with numbers, or unordered - with bullets) appearance in GemBox.Document is defined through class that is set on 's property or 's property.
is different from other formats ( and ) because it doesn't directly contain any formatting properties.
It contains a reference to a which exposes s for every list (indentation) level through its property.
s contain direct formatting properties that affect the appearance of the list. Every contains exactly 9 s, one for each possible list (indentation) level.

's list (indentation) level can be adjusted with ListFormat.ListLevelNumber property. 's list-related formatting will then be collected from the instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber. This can also be retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property.

retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property can be additionally modified to enable overriding property values of instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber on a or basis.

To create a list in a document, first instance has to be created from one of the predefined list style types specified with enumeration. After that, can be created with a specified and assigned to a 's property. For a complete example, see Lists example.
If is not referenced from anywhere in the document (from any or , then it won't be saved to a Word Document (DOCX) file, unless it is added to collection.
's list content, which prefixes paragraph content, is represented by type.
s are not permanently stored in model nor they are written to file formats which fully support , instead they are recreated each time method is called.
If document content or formatting is changed, then method should be called again to retrieve the latest list items.
For convenience, after calling method, can also be retrieved from property.

After calling on instance retrieved by calling on instance returned from method, paragraph's property will be even if paragraph's is . This enables easy iteration over s returned from method by using foreach statement and removing all references to s after the iteration is finished.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Note
member.summary: Represents a footnote or an endnote in the document.
member.remarks:
can be configured using on a document level ( and ) or on a section level ( and . Document level settings are cloned when new is added to the . is currently supported in DOCX and PDF formats. While DOCX format is fully supported, PDF format has the following limitations:
Footnotes are always rendered on the same page as their references.
Footnotes that don't fit on a single page are clipped.
Note numbering setting is not supported.
