member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Picture
member.summary: Represents a picture.

remarks.para: is a that enables inserting a bitmap, which consists of the pixel data for a graphics image and its attributes, within a document content.
Picture.PictureStream and Picture.Format properties define a and are mandatory in a constructors, directly or indirectly.
can be clipped to a specific shape. Clipping shape type is represented by enumeration. It can be set only through constructor and retrieved from property.
can be filled with a (which will be visible if picture has transparent pixel data) and outlined with a .
can be positioned in-line with the rest of the document content or floating within document content. For more information about picture positioning, see remarks for DrawingElement.Layout property.
For more information, see pictures example.

remarks.para: This constructor instantiates object (for getting and calculating width and height in points). This approach slightly impairs performance (instantiating object requires around 20-50ms for larger images) so, if performance is crucial or you need to insert a lot of images, use constructors that accept argument.
Image formats , , and are converted to since they are not supported in GemBox.Document component.
and are used when calculating width and height in points.

If you want to insert document content element into some other part of the same document, then clone the element and insert its clone.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.PageBorders.MeasureFromEdgeOfPage

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the property on each page shall be interpreted as the distance from the edge of the page or as the distance from the that shall be left before the page border.
Default value: .

member.value: to interpret the property on each page as the distance from the edge of the page that shall be left before the page border; otherwise, to interpret it as the distance from the that shall be left before the page border.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.PageBorders.AlignParagraphBordersAndTableEdgesWithPageBorder

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether paragraph borders specified using the property and table borders using the property shall be adjusted to align with extents of the page border defined using the property if the spacing between these borders is less than or equal to 10.5 points (one character width) or less from the page border.

value of this property shall ensure there are no gaps of one character width or less between adjoining page and paragraph/table borders, as borders which are perfectly aligning shall not be displayed in favor of the intervening page border.
If value of this property is , then borders shall not be automatically adjusted to prevent gaps of less than one character width.
If the page border is not measured from the text extents ( is ), then this property is ignored.
This property is stored in , therefore it applies to the entire document.
Supported only in DOCX and DOC formats. This value is currently ignored when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats.
Default value: .

member.value: if paragraph borders specified using the property and table borders using the property shall be adjusted to align with extents of the page border defined using the property if the spacing between these borders is less than or equal to 10.5 points (one character width) or less from the page border; otherwise, .

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.PageSetup.PaperType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the paper for the page.

remarks.para: Default value for this property is .
This member is supported in printing.

GemBox.Document uses enhanced printing services provided with Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF). All pages of a specific will be printed with settings from of that section. Internally, WPF printing uses PrintTicket class to specify page printing settings and value of this member is applied to appropriate member of PrintTicket instance which is used to print all pages of a section with this print options member.
PrintTicket instance which is used to print every page of a section is constructed in following order:

item.description: Based on stream specified in constructor (base print ticket).
Appropriate base print ticket members are set based on instance members values.
Base print ticket is cloned for each section, clone's appropriate members are set based on instance of that section and clone is used to print all pages of that section.

remarks.para: Printing settings which do not exist in nor in can be specified on base print ticket (which stream is passed to constructor).

member.value: The type of the paper.

item.description: Based on stream specified in constructor (base print ticket).

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Paragraph
member.summary: Represents a paragraph of content in the document.

remarks.para: is one of the main document building blocks. It can be contained under a , , , or .
is a content element that contains derived elements in its Paragraph.Inlines property. For more information, see content model.

can be formatted using the Paragraph.ParagraphFormat property, and it can also be formatted to be used as a part of the list using the Paragraph.ListFormat property. For more information about paragraph formatting, see paragraph formatting example.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.Paragraph.ListFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the list format.
member.value: The list format.

remarks.para: List (for example, ordered - with numbers, or unordered - with bullets) appearance in GemBox.Document is defined through class that is set on 's property or 's property.
is different from other formats ( and ) because it doesn't directly contain any formatting properties.
It contains a reference to a which exposes s for every list (indentation) level through its property.
s contain direct formatting properties that affect the appearance of the list. Every contains exactly 9 s, one for each possible list (indentation) level.

's list (indentation) level can be adjusted with ListFormat.ListLevelNumber property. 's list-related formatting will then be collected from the instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber. This can also be retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property.

retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property can be additionally modified to enable overriding property values of instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber on a or basis.

To create a list in a document, first instance has to be created from one of the predefined list style types specified with enumeration. After that, can be created with a specified and assigned to a 's property. For a complete example, see Lists example.
If is not referenced from anywhere in the document (from any or , then it won't be saved to a Word Document (DOCX) file, unless it is added to collection.
's list content, which prefixes paragraph content, is represented by type.
s are not permanently stored in model nor they are written to file formats which fully support , instead they are recreated each time method is called.
If document content or formatting is changed, then method should be called again to retrieve the latest list items.
For convenience, after calling method, can also be retrieved from property.

After calling on instance retrieved by calling on instance returned from method, paragraph's property will be even if paragraph's is . This enables easy iteration over s returned from method by using foreach statement and removing all references to s after the iteration is finished.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.Paragraph.Revision
member.summary: Gets or sets the revision information for the paragraph.
member.value: The revision information for the paragraph.
member.remarks: If the revision is of the type it means that this paragraph and the following paragraph were a single paragraph before applying this revision. If the revision is of the type it means that this paragraph and the following paragraph were separate paragraphs but they were joined after applying this revision. The revision is internally stored as a member of . Using set property on overrides this revision.

member.summary: Gets or sets the revision of the character format for the paragraph mark. This property contains the format which was applied before the revision.
member.value: The revision of the character format for the paragraph mark.
member.remarks: The revision is internally stored as a member of . Using set property on overrides this revision.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.Paragraph.ParagraphFormatRevision
member.summary: Gets or sets the revision of the format of this paragraph. This property contains the format which was applied to this paragraph before the revision.
member.value: The revision of the format of this paragraph.
member.remarks: The revision is internally stored as a member of . Using set property on overrides this revision.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.ParagraphStyle
member.summary: Represents a style which can be applied to one or more s within a document content.

remarks.para: Styles provide a way to format your document in a consistent way so when you change your formatting options on a style, all document elements referencing that style will be changed.
To apply a to a , set it to a ParagraphFormat.Style property on a Paragraph.ParagraphFormat.
For an example how to apply to a , see styles example.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.ParagraphStyle.ListFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the list format.
member.value: The list format.

remarks.para: List (for example, ordered - with numbers, or unordered - with bullets) appearance in GemBox.Document is defined through class that is set on 's property or 's property.
is different from other formats ( and ) because it doesn't directly contain any formatting properties.
It contains a reference to a which exposes s for every list (indentation) level through its property.
s contain direct formatting properties that affect the appearance of the list. Every contains exactly 9 s, one for each possible list (indentation) level.

's list (indentation) level can be adjusted with ListFormat.ListLevelNumber property. 's list-related formatting will then be collected from the instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber. This can also be retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property.

retrieved from the ListFormat.ListLevelFormat property can be additionally modified to enable overriding property values of instance contained in the ListStyle.ListLevelFormats at the position ListFormat.ListLevelNumber on a or basis.

To create a list in a document, first instance has to be created from one of the predefined list style types specified with enumeration. After that, can be created with a specified and assigned to a 's property. For a complete example, see Lists example.
If is not referenced from anywhere in the document (from any or , then it won't be saved to a Word Document (DOCX) file, unless it is added to collection.
's list content, which prefixes paragraph content, is represented by type.
s are not permanently stored in model nor they are written to file formats which fully support , instead they are recreated each time method is called.
If document content or formatting is changed, then method should be called again to retrieve the latest list items.
For convenience, after calling method, can also be retrieved from property.

After calling on instance retrieved by calling on instance returned from method, paragraph's property will be even if paragraph's is . This enables easy iteration over s returned from method by using foreach statement and removing all references to s after the iteration is finished.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.PdfConformanceLevel
member.summary: Represents levels of conformance for PDF documents.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.PdfConformanceLevel.None
member.summary: No conformance.

summary.para: PDF/A-1 is based on PDF version 1.4, which first appeared in 2001. All resources (images, graphics, typographic characters) must be embedded within the PDF/A document itself. A PDF/A file requires precise, platform-independent colour data using ICC profiles, and XMP for the document metadata. Transparent elements, some forms of compression (LZW, JPEG2000), PDF layers, and certain actions or JavaScript are forbidden. A PDF/A file must not be password-protected. PDF/A-1 expressly supports embedded digital signatures and the use of hyperlinks.

Level A (Accessible) meets all requirements for the standard, including the logical structure of the document and its correct reading order. Text must be extractable and the logical structure must match the natural reading order. Fonts used must meet stringent requirements. This PDF/A level can usually only be met by converting born-digital documents.

PDF/A-1 is based on PDF version 1.4, which first appeared in 2001. All resources (images, graphics, typographic characters) must be embedded within the PDF/A document itself. A PDF/A file requires precise, platform-independent colour data using ICC profiles, and XMP for the document metadata. Transparent elements, some forms of compression (LZW, JPEG2000), PDF layers, and certain actions or JavaScript are forbidden. A PDF/A file must not be password-protected. PDF/A-1 expressly supports embedded digital signatures and the use of hyperlinks.

Level B (Basic) guarantees that the content of the document can be unambiguously reproduced. Level B files are easier to create than Level A, but Level B does not guarantee 100% text extraction or searchability. It does not necessarily mean that the content can be reused without any problems. Scanned paper documents can usually be converted to PDF/A Conformance Level B without any extra work.

PDF/A-2 was published in 2011 as "ISO 19005-2". Based on PDF version 1.7, which has since been standardised as "ISO 32000-1", it makes use of this version‚Äôs new features. This means PDF/A-2 allows JPEG2000 compression, transparent elements and PDF layers. PDF/A-2 also allows you to embed OpenType fonts and supports PAdES(PDF Advanced Electronic Signatures)-compliant digital signatures. One particularly important innovation is the "container" function: PDF/A files can be embedded within a PDF/A-2 document.

Level A (Accessible) meets all requirements for the standard, including the logical structure of the document and its correct reading order. Text must be extractable and the logical structure must match the natural reading order. Fonts used must meet stringent requirements. This PDF/A level can usually only be met by converting born-digital documents.

PDF/A-2 was published in 2011 as "ISO 19005-2". Based on PDF version 1.7, which has since been standardised as "ISO 32000-1", it makes use of this version‚Äôs new features. This means PDF/A-2 allows JPEG2000 compression, transparent elements and PDF layers. PDF/A-2 also allows you to embed OpenType fonts and supports PAdES(PDF Advanced Electronic Signatures)-compliant digital signatures. One particularly important innovation is the "container" function: PDF/A files can be embedded within a PDF/A-2 document.

Level B (Basic) guarantees that the content of the document can be unambiguously reproduced. Level B files are easier to create than Level A, but Level B does not guarantee 100% text extraction or searchability. It does not necessarily mean that the content can be reused without any problems. Scanned paper documents can usually be converted to PDF/A Conformance Level B without any extra work.

PDF/A-2 was published in 2011 as "ISO 19005-2". Based on PDF version 1.7, which has since been standardised as "ISO 32000-1", it makes use of this version‚Äôs new features. This means PDF/A-2 allows JPEG2000 compression, transparent elements and PDF layers. PDF/A-2 also allows you to embed OpenType fonts and supports PAdES(PDF Advanced Electronic Signatures)-compliant digital signatures. One particularly important innovation is the "container" function: PDF/A files can be embedded within a PDF/A-2 document.
Level U (Unicode) was introduced along with PDF/A-2. It expands Conformance Level B to specify that all text can be mapped to standard Unicode character codes.

PDF/A-3 has been available since October 2012. A PDF/A-3 document allows you to embed any file format desired ‚Äì not just PDF/A documents. For example, a PDF/A-3 file can contain the original file from which it was generated. The PDF/A standard does not regulate the suitability of these embedded files for archiving.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.PdfSaveOptions.Permissions
member.summary: Gets or sets the operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document.
member.value: The operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: Generated PDF document will be encrypted if any of the following conditions are satisfied:

item.description: is different than .
is not or .
is not or .

remarks.para: Both and are optional but with the following consequences:

item.description: If is different than and is not specified, component will generate random .
Using , also known as owner password, without is not secure. It relies on PDF viewer software to respect specified restrictions, but it may choose not to do so.
Using , also known as user password, is potentially very secure. It or is required for decrypting and viewing the document.

When is specified, PDF viewer application will prompt for password to decrypt and present the document. If entered password is , document will be decrypted and presented with specified enforced. Otherwise, if entered password is , document will be decrypted and presented without any restrictions.

remarks.para: and cannot be equal, otherwise exception is thrown.
For more information, see PDF Encryption example.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.PdfSaveOptions.ImageDpi
member.summary: Gets or sets the saved images DPI.
member.value: The saved images DPI.
member.remarks:
This property controls the image quality for all images in the file. Larger value results in better-quality images but increases the file size. Setting this property to 0 will disable image optimization. Standard DPI values are:
330 - Good quality for HD displays
220 - Good quality for most printers and displays
150 - Good quality for web pages and projectors
96 - Good quality for smaller file sizes

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.PdfSaveOptions.MetafileScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images. Greater scaling factor improves quality but also increases file size. Default value is 1.
member.value: The metafile scale factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images.

remarks.para: Windows Metafile Format (WMF) and Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) are vector image formats which contain a series of graphics drawing commands usually executed in Windows GDI layer.
Metafile drawing commands could also be executed in PDF (or XPS) file which is also vector format, but for that Metafile drawing commands would have to be converted to PDF drawing commands.

GemBox.Document currently doesn't perform this conversion of drawing commands, instead it uses Windows GDI to execute Metafile drawing commands into bitmap which is then encoded to PNG format and embedded into PDF file.
specifies the size of the bitmap surface, based from the original Metafile surface size, into which Metafile should be drawn / rasterized.

PDF viewer will still scale the bitmap to the original Metafile size, but if the page is zoomed or viewed on a larger surface, quality of the image will be better since it contains more pixels / dots which will become visible while PDF viewer scales down the image.

increases the quality of the Metafile image in PDF file, but it also increases the size of the PDF file because greater means greater bitmap surface and more space to store bitmap pixel / color data. PNG encoding / compression helps in reducing the space requirement and for complex Metafiles (with a lot of drawing instructions), of 5 or even greater, might not incur any space overhead relative to the original (complex) Metafile.
Default value for is 1.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.PrintOptions.MetafileScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images. Greater scaling factor improves quality but also increases file size. Default value is 1.
member.value: The metafile scale factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images.

remarks.para: Windows Metafile Format (WMF) and Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) are vector image formats which contain a series of graphics drawing commands usually executed in Windows GDI layer.
Metafile drawing commands could also be executed in PDF (or XPS) file which is also vector format, but for that Metafile drawing commands would have to be converted to PDF drawing commands.

GemBox.Document currently doesn't perform this conversion of drawing commands, instead it uses Windows GDI to execute Metafile drawing commands into bitmap which is then encoded to PNG format and embedded into PDF file.
specifies the size of the bitmap surface, based from the original Metafile surface size, into which Metafile should be drawn / rasterized.

PDF viewer will still scale the bitmap to the original Metafile size, but if the page is zoomed or viewed on a larger surface, quality of the image will be better since it contains more pixels / dots which will become visible while PDF viewer scales down the image.

increases the quality of the Metafile image in PDF file, but it also increases the size of the PDF file because greater means greater bitmap surface and more space to store bitmap pixel / color data. PNG encoding / compression helps in reducing the space requirement and for complex Metafiles (with a lot of drawing instructions), of 5 or even greater, might not incur any space overhead relative to the original (complex) Metafile.
Default value for is 1.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.PrintOptions.DocumentName

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the printed document in the print queue.
Default value is 'Document'.

member.value: The name of the printed document in the print queue.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.RtfSaveOptions.ExportPictureWithMetafile
member.summary: RTF supports inclusion of JPEG, PNG, EMF, WMF, Apple PICT, Windows bitmap and OS/2 Metafile picture types. Not all of these picture types are supported in all RTF readers. When a RTF document is opened in software that does not support the picture type of an inserted picture, such picture is not displayed at all. For better compatibility with some Microsoft applications (e.g. Wordpad) two copies of the graphic are saved in the document. Graphics are saved in the applicable EMF, PNG, GIF, or JPEG format and are also converted to WMF (Windows Metafile) format. Property gets or sets the flag indicating whether to create a Windows Metafile (WMF) copy of the original picture when saving the instance.
member.value: to create a Windows Metafile (WMF) copy of the original picture when saving the instance; otherwise, .
member.remarks: WARNING: If property is set to , this code will only work in a Full-Trust environment. If you attempt to run the code in a Medium-Trust environment, a will be thrown.

cannot contain multiple elements with equal HeaderFooter.HeaderFooterType.
Following rules apply for headers / footers contained in a collection:

item.description: / - header / footer will be applied to every page in a section.
/ - header / footer will be applied to only even pages in a section. Overrides / on even pages, if also contained in a collection.
/ - header / footer will be applied to only first page in a section. Overrides both / and / on first page, if also contained in a collection.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Security.Certificate
member.summary: Represents an X.509 certificate sent to others so that they can verify your digital signature with a public key contained in the certificate.

remarks.para: GemBox.Document doesn't use class to represent a certificate because creates a file that holds the certificate with the public key (in various locations on a hard drive) and on some operating systems and platforms that file is not deleted unless method is called. This creation of a file prevents usages of certificates in Medium Trust.

Another reason why GemBox.Document abstracts a certificate with a class instead of using directly is to enable different implementations of a certificate. For example, either implementation from .NET or Org.BouncyCastle.X509.X509Certificate implementation from Bouncy Castle could be used.

member.seealso: RFC 5280: Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Profile

summary.para: Gets the spacing offset (in points) that shall be used to place this border on the parent object. Supported in DOCX and DOC formats. Supported in PDF format on and paragraph .

When a document has a page border that is relative to the page edges (using a value of in the on ), it shall specify the distance between the edge of the page and the beginning of this border in points.

When a document has a page border that is relative to the text extents (using a value of in the on ), it shall specify the distance between the margins of the page and the beginning of this border in points.

member.value: The spacing offset that shall be used to place this border on the parent object.
member.remarks: This value is currently ignored when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats if specified on a non-page or a non-paragraph border.

remarks.para: is a element used to define fields that span more than one , as opposite to element that represent a fields that span only through single .
Supported field types are: , , and .
is a content element with TableOfEntries.Entries as a content property that accepts only s.

If you want to insert document content element into some other part of the same document, then clone the element and insert its clone.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.TableOfEntries.Update
member.summary: Performs an update on TOC (Table of Contents) field.
member.remarks:
method is used for updating entire TOC field with new entries.
If is not specified method will set a default set of switches: \o "1-3" \h \u \z.
GemBox.Document automatically updates page numbers in TOC entries only for PDF, XPS and image file formats, for DOCX file format page numbers have a default value 1. Updating page numbers for TOC entries in DOCX can be achieved by creating an instance of , setting its to and calling the GetPaginator(PaginatorOptions) method with that instance. Supported TOC switches:
\o - Specifies the of enlisting header paragraphs.
\u - Specifies enlistment of all paragraphs with not equal to BodyText.
\t - Specifies enlistment of all paragraphs with defined custom styles.
\f - Specifies a unique identifier for TC fields enlistment.
\h - Specifies a usage.
\n - Specifies the of entries with omitted page number.
\l - Specifies the of enlisting TC fields.
\p - Specifies the character that separates entry and its page number.
\b - Specifies the name of the bookmark from which the paragraphs are enlisted. Supported TC switches:
\f - TC field's unique identifier.
\l - TC field's OutlineLevel.
\n - Omit page number.
For more information about TOC switches, see Field codes: TOC (Table of Contents) field.
For more information about TC switches, see Field codes: TC (Table of Contents Entry) field.
member.seealso: Create and Update Word TOC in C# and VB.NET

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Tables.Table
member.summary: Represents a set of paragraphs (and other -level content) arranged in rows and columns.

remarks.para: is a derived content element consisting of s.
can be formatted using the Table.TableFormat property.
Default width for table columns can be specified with Table.Columns property.
For more information, see table examples.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows in row band for this table style.

member.exception: Row banding size must be greater than zero.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.Tables.TableFormat.AutomaticallyResizeToFitContents

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.Tables.TableFormat.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cells in this table shall be visually represented in a right to left direction. Supported in DOCX, DOC, PDF, XPS and image file formats.
member.value: if the cells in this table shall be visually represented in a right to left direction; otherwise, .

remarks.para: When this property is specified, then the ordering of all cells (and table-level properties) in this table shall be applied to the table assuming that the table is a normal left to right table, but the table cells shall be displayed in a right to left direction. Example: A left border on the first table cell must be displayed on the right side of that cell (which would be the rightmost cell) in a visually right to left table.

summary.para: Apply row banding conditional formatting.
Row banding is a grouping of rows into two successively alternating groups (odd and even).
Group size is specified by . Each group (odd and even) can have its own table style conditional formatting specified.
Apply column banding conditional formatting.
Column banding is a grouping of columns into two successively alternating groups (odd and even).
Group size is specified by . Each group (odd and even) can have its own table style conditional formatting specified.
Apply all conditional formats.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.TabStop
member.summary: Represents a single custom tab stop within a set of custom tab stops applied at ParagraphFormat.Tabs property.

remarks.para: Creating customized tabs in a document is accomplished with structure that enables you to define tab position, tab leader character and surrounding text alignment.
s should be inserted into ParagraphFormat.Tabs collection to be used in a .
Tabs are inserted into a document content with elements that have SpecialCharacter.CharacterType property equal to .
Values and are currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image file formats.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.TabStopAlignment
member.summary: Represents the available alignments for custom , which determines the behavior of the and the alignment which shall be applied to text entered at the current custom .

remarks.para: Creating customized tabs in a document is accomplished with structure that enables you to define tab position, tab leader character and surrounding text alignment.
s should be inserted into ParagraphFormat.Tabs collection to be used in a .
Tabs are inserted into a document content with elements that have SpecialCharacter.CharacterType property equal to .
Values and are currently not supported in PDF, XPS and image file formats.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.TabStopAlignment.None
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop is cleared and shall be removed and ignored when processing the contents of the document.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.TabStopAlignment.Left
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop shall result in a location in the document where all following text is left aligned (i.e. all text runs following this tab stop and preceding the next tab stop shall be left aligned with respect to the tab stop location).

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.TabStopAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop shall result in a location in the document where all following text is centered (i.e. all text runs following this tab stop and preceding the next tab stop shall be centered around the tab stop location).

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.TabStopAlignment.Right
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop shall result in a location in the document where all following text is right aligned (i.e. all text runs following this tab stop and preceding the next tab stop shall be right aligned with respect to the tab stop location).

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.TabStopAlignment.Decimal
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab stop shall result in a location in the document where all following text is aligned around the first decimal character in the following text runs. All text runs before the first decimal character shall be before the tab stop, all text runs after it shall be after the tab stop location.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.TabStopAlignment.Bar
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab is a bar tab. A bar tab is a tab which does not result in a custom tab stop in the parent paragraph (this tab stop location shall be skipped when positioning custom tab characters), but instead shall be used to draw a vertical line (or bar) at this location in the parent paragraph.

member.name: F:GemBox.Document.TabStopAlignment.List
member.summary: Specifies that the current tab is a list tab, which is the tab stop between the numbering and the paragraph contents in a numbered paragraph.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.TextBox
member.summary: Represents a which serves as a container for elements which are outside page main content flow.

remarks.para: is a content consisting of derived elements (s and s).
's shape type (geometry) is represented by enumeration. It can be set only through constructor and retrieved from property.
can be filled with a and outlined with a .
can be positioned in-line with the rest of the document content or floating within document content. For more information, see remarks for DrawingElement.Layout property.

Imported text frames are converted to TextBoxes and will be exported back as text frames, if there were no changes to the following properties: , or . Any changes to those properties will result in a text frame being exported as a .

member.summary: Clones this instance.
member.param: If set to clone all descendants recursively; otherwise clone only current .
member.returns: Cloned .

remarks.para: Document content element instance can exist only in a one place in the document.
If you want to insert document content element into some other part of the same document, then clone the element and insert its clone.
If you want to insert document content element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with method and then insert the imported element.
For more information, see cloning example.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.TextColumn
member.summary: Represents a column in a .

remarks.para: Document content can be presented with more than one column, like in newspapers. To present a document with multiple columns, insert into PageSetup.TextColumns property on a parent .
For more information about , see page setup example.

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the watermark shape. To set the size as default, use empty size.
member.value: The size of the watermark shape.
member.remarks: The height of the TextWatermark is ignored when saving to PDF, XPS and image file formats. This is because GemBox.Document currently doesn't support scaling of characters in these formats which is necessary to support height independently of width. Currently the width is used and height is calculated to naturally fit the chosen font.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.Tracking.MoveRangeSeparator
member.summary:
Represents an element that is used to start or end a move range. The types of separators are:
MoveFromRangeStart - the start of the range that wraps the elements that were moved from this position.
MoveFromRangeEnd - the end of the range that wraps the elements that were moved from this position.
MoveToRangeStart - the start of the range that wraps the elements that were moved to this position.
MoveToRangeEnd - the end of the range that wraps the elements that were moved to this position.

member.name: M:GemBox.Document.Tracking.MoveRangeSeparator.#ctor(GemBox.Document.DocumentModel,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The value indicating whether this element is the start of the move range or the end.
The value indicating whether this element represents the position from which the contained elements were moved or the position to which the contained elements were moved.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the move.
member.value: The ID of the move.
member.remarks: The IDs of the move range's start and end should match in order for MS Word to display the move correctly.

member.summary: Gets or sets the author of the move.
member.value: The author of the move.

member.summary: Gets or sets the date when the move was created.
member.value: The date when the move was created.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.Tracking.MoveRangeSeparator.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the move. The name is used to tie together the move from and move to elements
member.value: The name of the move.
member.remarks: The name of the move from range and the move to range should match in order for MS Word to display the move correctly. The name of the end range is null and setting it's value has no effect.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.WriteProtection
member.summary: Represents the write protection options for the . Supported only in DOCX and DOC formats.

remarks.para: Write protection refers to a mode in which the document's contents can be edited but the document cannot be resaved using the same file name.
is currently not supported when exporting a document to PDF, XPS or image file formats.
For more information, see DOCX Write Protection example.

member.summary: Sets the write protection password for the current instance.
member.param: New write protection password (or to remove password from write protection).
member.remarks: Password is optional for write protection, but without it any user will be able to open the document as not read-only and thus be able to resave the document using the same file name.

member.name: T:GemBox.Document.XmlLoadOptions
member.summary: Represents a class that stores loading options for XML format. The only XML format that GemBox.Document currently supports is Flat OPC XML format. Flat OPC XML file can be created in MS Word by using "Word XML Document (*.xml)" as a save format. Please notice that this is different than "Word 2003 XML" format.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.XmlSaveOptions.ImageDpi
member.summary: Gets or sets the saved images DPI.
member.value: The saved images DPI.
member.remarks:
This property controls the image quality for all images in the file. Larger value results in better-quality images but increases the file size. Setting this property to 0 will disable image optimization. Standard DPI values are:
330 - Good quality for HD displays
220 - Good quality for most printers and displays
150 - Good quality for web pages and projectors
96 - Good quality for smaller file sizes

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.value: The content-type for XML file format.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.XpsSaveOptions.MetafileScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images. Greater scaling factor improves quality but also increases file size. Default value is 1.
member.value: The metafile scale factor for rendering metafile (WMF and EMF) images.

remarks.para: Windows Metafile Format (WMF) and Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) are vector image formats which contain a series of graphics drawing commands usually executed in Windows GDI layer.
Metafile drawing commands could also be executed in PDF (or XPS) file which is also vector format, but for that Metafile drawing commands would have to be converted to PDF drawing commands.

GemBox.Document currently doesn't perform this conversion of drawing commands, instead it uses Windows GDI to execute Metafile drawing commands into bitmap which is then encoded to PNG format and embedded into PDF file.
specifies the size of the bitmap surface, based from the original Metafile surface size, into which Metafile should be drawn / rasterized.

PDF viewer will still scale the bitmap to the original Metafile size, but if the page is zoomed or viewed on a larger surface, quality of the image will be better since it contains more pixels / dots which will become visible while PDF viewer scales down the image.

increases the quality of the Metafile image in PDF file, but it also increases the size of the PDF file because greater means greater bitmap surface and more space to store bitmap pixel / color data. PNG encoding / compression helps in reducing the space requirement and for complex Metafiles (with a lot of drawing instructions), of 5 or even greater, might not incur any space overhead relative to the original (complex) Metafile.
Default value for is 1.

member.name: P:GemBox.Document.XpsSaveOptions.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the content-type for XPS file format: application/vnd.ms-xpsdocument.
member.value: The content-type for XPS file format.
